text:
Drive-thru is always fast.

I don't like going inside, though. Inside has a very different atmosphere. The staff there seems less interested in customer service. But the drive thru team is stellar.

I would always pay a visit to this place for their Holiday Pies ... Oh and honeslty i would have ordered a happy meal for myself just cause their giving out Hello Kitty watches which unfortunately they happen to run out. Boo!!!

I would give zero stars if I could. I've been to this specific location on multiple occasions..just for them to tell me "THEIR SYSTEMS ARE DOWN." It's always late night shifts that they've told me this. So I don't know if this establishment is the only McDonald's that can't get someone to FIX their systems or if their night shift workers just don't want to work.

Drive through is pretty fast. 
I came with my friends, just wanting a few sodas. Drove up, ordered 2 diet pepsis and an unsweetened ice tea with extra ice. They didn't repeat the order, so I was kinda unsure if they got my order right. Sure enough, they gave me a sweetened tea (lacking ice). Of course I didn't notice until we had left the area so, there was no point in going back. Kinda disappointed that they can't get an order of 3 soft drinks correct.
This is for the morning people/ during breakfast hours. They don't pay attention to you or repeat your orders. I bought 4 sausage mcgriddles and they gave me 4 bacon mcgriddles

I went to this McDonalds yesterday evening and they were of course sold out of everything I wanted. But I'm giving them four stars because even if I was upset with them for not having anything, I stayed calm because of the wonderful girl working the drive thru. She politely told me they were sold out of everything and apologized remorsefully for the companies mistake.

This McDonald's puts real flowers on the tables.

WTF.

AND, it's a gas station McDonald's.  It's not even a free-standing McDonald's. Mind=boggled.

Anyways...I never eat at McDonald's but had a hankerin' one morning for hot cakes.  I was a little perplexed walking in, however, because the decor was really modern and...tasteful.  Not what you expect from a McDonald's.  A+ franchisee, A+.

Also, I learned a great thing, the greatest thing I learned in all of August 2012.  McDonald's now serves dipped cones! And, they're good.  Screw off DQ, I'm going to fancy McDonald's from now on!

Worst McDonald's I've ever eaten at! The fries were room temperature & hard as a rock like they've been sitting for days. The buttermilk chicken sandwich was stale & the worst part is that the dining area smells like shit. I've seen them use the same mop for the bathroom & the dining area, which would explain that. I refuse to ever eat here again.

Where do you go when you're dying of thirst and don't want to spend a fortune?  McDonalds. Dollar menu for sodas rocks. They're usually pretty quick through the drive-through, although sometimes you get people who don't seem to understand what soda water is. But the fact that McDonald's even has soda water, makes me really happy. If you're know the mood to splurge, a vanilla shake and fries hit the spot. I also love their sweet BBQ burger!

This location is closer to my house and I wish they were consistent, but unfortunately they are not.  They are currently upgrading their drive-thru and exterior, but it doesn't make up for their lack of order accuracy.  On a side note, the redesign of the drive thru is horrible as well.  (You'll know when you see it).  I'll just keep driving over to the Flamingo location even though it's further out.

It's okay. It's a McDonald's. Workers are rather slower than usual on the day I came but I didn't really mind, wasn't in a rush. The manager is honestly helpful and nice. They are really pushing for that touchscreen order thing. Regardless, I'd say 80/100 overall
I just order the ice coffee it takes them over 10 mine to give it to me. All the worker there just talking and walk around. What the service is that ?
This is the most horrible McDonald's ever. And I keep getting suckerd to go since it is right next to my house. :/. No more it's just not worth it.
We can put a monkey in space but the girl this morning at the drive thru can't get an order right...... 15 per hour....not!!!!!
They know what they are doing at this restaurant. Occasional mistakes but I freakin love McDonald's.

Out of sweet tea. How hard is it to brew some tea and add some sugar to it. And these idiots want $15 an hour? They can't even bought be bothered to do a simple task. Didn't even bother ordering my breakfast without sweet tea there is no point. I'll just have to stop by another McDonald's. This place is a failure.
Just took one look at the new prices 9.99 for all breakfast combos! I hardly come here to begin with but now I'm never coming here with these rip off prices esp for McDonald's fast food?! Get real

Horrible Drive-thru service. I had one of the most simple orders. 2 Happy Meals, one was a plain Cheese burger and the other Chicken nuggets. I took my order,  when I get home my son tells me that they forgot his cheese burger. I had to drive back and when I got there I told them that they forgot the cheese burger, the lady said "oh yeah, they forgot" like it was no big deal. Note to self ALWAYS CHECK YOUR ORDER BEFORE LEAVING.

Just ordered the new Tenders and they are garbage! . Deep fried, greasy and just not tasty at all! For-sure not the same ones they used to have. Thumbs down.
If I wasn't pregnant and starving I would have went back for my money.

Horrible service. How you can possibly mess up a biscuit, two oatmeal, and coffee is beyond me. On top of that I waited 10 minutes for them to give me oatmeal still not done, nothing I asked for and a coffee that I asked for cream and Splenda that had none of either. This is pretty simple stuff and they still messed up and took forever to do it. I will not be returning here.

Late night drive thru is ALWAYS a mess here. I laid off coming to this particular location for a while and decided to give them another chance. Nope still the same, So I arrived around 10:30PM and the drive thru only had 3 cars in it and my wait time was STILL over 13 minutes and I can't understand why. Why?! What is the point of calling it fast food when nothing about the entire experience is fast? I expect that if I wait in a drive thru to have my food be piping hot fresh out the grease if that's the case. Not to open my bag to find any kind of luke warm food. After that long wait I STILL had to wait longer because I sent my order back and requested that my food be fresh. I won't be returning to this location at all...

We know what to expect from these types of quick service restaurants. However, this location's setup is very awkward with people gathering in the front and difficult to establish where the ordering line is as a result. 

Their mobile ordering kiosks are a great idea but they don't have them programmed with enough options to order things other than the basics- so if you have specific requests, you must order at the cashier- however, they have placed all 4 areas (2 kiosks, pick-ups and cashier ordering) within 120 sq ft space, with the drink machine lines also bleeding into these other spaces... bad circulation and space planning. They aren't setup for successful quick service. 

Quality is basically your typical, ya never know what you're gunna get.

This place is horrible. No toys or happy meals for my little girl. They man taking order was rude and not helpful. The worst McDonald's in Vegas and it was dirty. Slow service and the guy at register didn't give me back correct change. He was even having trouble taking people's orders. Will never visit this location again. I rarely give bad reviews but this place needs a refresher on customer service.

My local dollar menu stop off after a crazy gym session haha 

Quick and easy 

Fresh hot and spices always

I actually visited the McDonads inside the Walmart across the street from this place. I couldn't check in because it was attached to the Walmart..?

Anyway, Walmart McDonalds are the stingiest. Extra price for everything.

They have this cool deal though. 20 nuggets, 2 large fries, 2 large drinks for $10. Not bad if you're in the mood for nuggets.

Other than that, go to a different Mickey D's.

I've been here a couple of times and it seems like there's something wrong each time except this last visit.

One time, Apple Pay wasn't working except on one terminal that was closed.  Another time, they were out of the ingredients for the shake I stopped for--the Shamrock Shake.  This time, everything, was in order.  They made the shake, I paid with Apple Pay, and the counter critter was personable.

The only thing that would raise my rating would be to have a better in and out.  I don't do drive through and I find because of the way the McDonald's part of the building is situated, the parking is atrocious especially when you have to cross the drive through lane to walk there.

The worst McDonald's I've ever been to, I don't know why we keep coming back when there's a better one on Durango. 
Every single time I've come here they forget something. It never fails.
Long line.The service is slow, only one person at the counter taking, and filling orders. The men's restroom stinks horribly, needs to be cleaned.
Drive thru employee closed the window on my mother, and proceeded to stick her tongue out at her. That is soooooo very unprofessional. I'm so disappointed.

This location is connected to a Terrible Herbst Chevron. 

I don't understand all the negative reviews because my experiences at this location have always been pleasant. Granted, I always just go to the drive-thru to order my food and/or drink. The employees during the breakfast shifts have always been friendly. They have always said hi when I pull up to the first window and thank me before driving away. My orders have been correct, especially with my 3 creamers and 1 Equal in my hot coffee (which I think is quite delicious and keeps me perky.) and I've never waited too long in the drive-thru line. There have also been 2 times where they didn't have small cups for my drink so I ended up with a large cup for free. Score!! That is all.

The cashier in the drive threw window picked her nose and did not wash her hands. I did not except the food and parked I than went in and demanded a manager for refund. When I told the manager what happened she went over to the girl and started talking a different language other than English or Spanish and laughing like they was best friends. The manager gave me a refund and did not say sorry or anything else. Good luck if you go to this location.
friendly customer service.  unlimited napkins and ketchups.  food line moves great.

You know I actually come here every 2-3 months because I walk here while my car is getting a oil change at the shop across the street. Every time my food came out as it should. I won't give them 4 stars for quality of food or cooking but I think most of us come in knowing what to expect. More like 3 stars. The reviews are what I expect from people who see minimum wage earners as beneath them. That's what I hate about this city. People abusing people, especially in the casinos (lucky I never had to). They pay for a $1 menu item and expect it served to them on a silver platter, and on hand and foot. Neigh you sultans of "squash". (I am using an euphemism even though I love squash!") Princesses of peas.

I am sure the employees of McDonalds are swimming in their largesse because of your extreme generosity in their enormous pay.
Boy, that lady, who was so indignant because a business might have been so busy they ran out of sweet tea or had mechanical difficulties. Minimum wage here is nowhere close to $15 in NV. Would you take their job and the abuse?

Like I said, the food isn't the greatest but they make it the same as other McDonalds I have been to. Today, my fries came kind of soggy. Usually they are crispy. That's what they are known for. The soda was a little more flat than usual. The fire alarm went off twice as false alarms in my 30 min stay. At least they are working and not sitting at home waiting for public assistance. Give them a break. They are usually pretty cheery when they take my order. A little kindness goes a long way.

This place absolutely sucks. Every time I come here, Every Time, they screw up my order. My worst experience here was when I stopped by for a late night snack and they forgot an order of nuggets that they charged me for. i drive back around and they just closed and wouldn't even open the window to listen to me. I understand its a safety thing but they still took my money and didn't give me my food. Management was apologetic but never offered me either my money back or to give me my food. I was over it and didn't want to waste anymore time on this place.

Horrible customer service. Very unfriendly. When I complained to a manager about the service received, he defended his staff instead of apologizing. There is way to much competition to treat customers with such disrespect. Burger King is across the street, will go there for breakfast every morning before work instead of this McDonalds.

This one was attached to the gas station here at my corner and I've never been inside, and even though I like McDonalds. I rarely eat here except for bkfst once a week, on my way to work.  But I had to stop in and get my filling of McRib (YEA BABY) :-)  When I walked inside, it was actually VERY nice looking.  It didn't look like the typical McDonalds dining room.  It had beautiful cushion benches/booths and it was quiet too. You would've thought you were in a nice coffee house.  

The price for my McRib was $1.99 each (which seemed like a fair price) I had that and a medium fry and an order of chocolate chip cookies (I love their cookies).  

I got home, the sandwiches were hot and yummmmmmmmyyy. Fries were just ok, and the cookies were really good too.  

If I just wanted to get out sometime and go for a coffee or a small treat or bkfst. I would definitely go and relax in their dining room.

You could have fill up my smoothies and cafes a bit more for what I paid. Its $10 for god's sake. There was no common essentials like napkins. That is important! Cashier was fine. She did said something inappropriate but that did not deduct a star from me. She made up by giving me my requests. They now have kiosk machines instead of waiting in line. Easy to use. Overall, the experience was cloudy. I will give this place a try!

Drive thru service got slower after the latest renovation. Now the cars get jammed up in the line and it still takes forever. I keep seeing people leave out of frustration. Prior to this, the neighborhood had to deal with Rowena hoarding the condiments, straws, and napkins. (This location seems to like to sell each happy meal toy one at a time.)

Had the worst craving off Mcdonald's after work so I went there to get something to eat.
Score for first off all it was open the service was fast but only one minus on it.

I ordered cheeseburger as well didn't pay attention until I came home so a bit bummed but it's okay it's not the guys fault it's late shit happens.

Overall not bad service

I just got an order of French fries that look like someone ladled in a couple heaping teaspoons of fryer grease as a special topping for me.  Although they gave me a big wad of napkins, it wasn't enough to absorb the scary mess.  Did I visit at the wrong time of day? Perhaps shift change? 
They get one star for courteous friendly service but unfortunately I couldn't eat the food.  Being able to serve edible food is pretty crucial too.
